descriptions: No graphs are presented or all graphs are completely incorrect.
Graphs are attempted, but most have major errors in shape, intercepts, or asymptotes.
Some graphs are accurate, but others contain significant errors.
Most graphs are accurate, with only minor errors in intercepts or asymptotes.
All graphs are accurate with only very minor errors.
All six trigonometric functions are graphed accurately, showing correct shape, intercepts, asymptotes, and domain/range.
Demonstrates no understanding of amplitude, period, phase shift, or vertical shift.
Demonstrates very limited understanding of key features; struggles to identify any correctly.
Identifies some key features correctly, but struggles with others or provides incomplete explanations.
Identifies most key features correctly and provides reasonable explanations.
Clearly understands and correctly identifies all key features of the trigonometric functions.
Demonstrates comprehensive understanding of key features and explains their impact on the graphs of trigonometric functions.
Uses very little mathematical terminology, or uses it incorrectly.
Uses some mathematical terminology, but with some inaccuracies.
Uses appropriate mathematical terminology most of the time.
Uses appropriate mathematical terminology accurately and consistently.
Uses mathematical terminology precisely and effectively to communicate understanding of trigonometric functions.
